settings.title: How long will homemade ice cream cake last in the freezer?
settings.text: A homemade ice cream cake can generally be stored in the freezer for up to two to three months without significant loss of quality. However, for the best taste and texture, it's advisable to consume it within the first month. Proper storage in an airtight container or wrapped securely helps maintain freshness and prevents freezer burn.

settings.title: Do I have to use an ice cream maker?
settings.text: While using an ice cream maker can streamline the process and result in a smoother texture, it is not strictly necessary for making ice cream. Alternatives include the manual method of stirring the mixture during freezing or utilizing a food processor for aeration. However, an ice cream maker generally produces better results in terms of consistency and creaminess.

custom_css: header {margin-top: auto; margin-bottom: auto; margin-right: 1rem; margin-left: -1rem;}
@media (min-width: 769px) {div {display: grid; grid-template-rows: auto auto; grid-template-columns: auto auto; column-gap: 2rem; } div > header {grid-column: 1 / -1; margin-bottom: 1rem; }}
div > div > div > button > :nth-child(2) {display: block; width: 14rem;}
div > div > div {display: flex; flex-direction: column;}
